page.title: 03Foxearth - 2
page.content: The village is really just the one main street. Some little old cottages have been demolished in favour of modern bungalows; but, since being designated a Conservation Area, the centre cannot be altered much. The C15 Hall still has part of its defensive moat. The biggest house is the early Victorian old Rectory; the Lodge at its gate is pretend Tudor. The only shop and the blacksmith's forge have had to close, and so has the little brewery - but the red brick arched entrance remains. The windmill - gone. The Congregational Chapel is now used as a garage. There used to be a spire on top of the church tower; it was blown off in a freak whirlwind. Among saints painted on the rood screen is Apollonia, carrying some forceps; she kept her faith though her teeth were pulled out - dentists' patron saint!
